title.narrative: Provision of WASH facilities for CBE/schools Children and Communities in Sabari, Musakhail, and Nadershahkot districts of Khost Province

description.narrative:
AWEC will directly implement this project in Sabari, Musakhail, and Nadershahkot districts of Khost Province in collaboration with the EiE working group and relevant clusters and other members. Based on our agreement with one of the local NGOs in Khost AWEC will use the office space of the local NGO during the implementation of the project. The project is targeting the most vulnerable IDP/returnees, refugees, and host communities in Afghanistan, with a particular focus on girls and IDP and returnee refugee communities. The project is inlined with the Afghanistan constitution, National Education Strategic Plan (NESP) III priorities, the Afghanistan Humanitarian Response Plan for 2018-21 (Outcome 2.4), and the Education in Emergencies Working Group (EiE-WG) goal this project will provide safe and equitable access to education. The program aims to improve access to education through community-based approaches and provide learning opportunities for emergency affected girls and boys. Through this program, AWEC will undertake the below activities:
Activity#1: Provision of disinfection materials for schools and CBEs, Activity#2: Provision of handwashing facilities, Soap, Clean drinking water
Activity#3: Distribution of re-usable masks for teachers and students Activity#4: Printing and distribution of self- learning materials for the most vulnerable children
Totally, 40,800 individuals including men, women, girls, boys, and persons with disabilities will be benefited directly by the implementation of this project. The project intends to increase access towards quality basic education in a safe learning environment for the CBE and school-aged boys and girls affected by emergencies in Khost province.
Despite the long history in development, AWEC has experience in humanitarian activities. AWEC actively engaged in social media awareness-raising and working with clients such as street children on COVID-19 we have already helped with items distribution that help with preventing virus spread. As well as, AWEC has conducted some successful awareness campaigns by involving youth groups to be part of these campaigns through social media.
Prior to the implementation phase, the project will be fully coordinated with MoE at the national level, PEDs at the provincial level, and the DEDs at the district level for better and smooth implementation of the project in targeted locations. According to our knowledge, understanding, and familiarity with the context of Khost province, AWEC has established relationships with the community leaders, CDC members, religious leaders, and some community members even in hard to reach areas which will facilitate the smooth implementation of this project.
